page.description: You can create named storage connection strings for Google Drive. Google Drive storage connections can be used with the Xbasic storage functions to read files from and save files to a folder in Google Drive.

description.p: Before you build a storage connection string for Google Drive, you need to enable the Google Drive API in the Google Cloud console and add a Service Account. The Service Account will need permissions to access your Google Drive folder(s).
Go to the *[extlink:Google Cloud console@https://console.developers.google.com]* and create a new project. If you already have an existing project, you can use that project.
Enable the *[extlink:Google Drive api@https://console.developers.google.com/apis/]* for your project.
Create a key for the service account using the JSON option. Download the JSON file.
Get the email address for the service account and share the Google drive with the email address of your service account.

Locate the id of the Google Drive folder you want to use in your storage connection string. The id is found after the *[bold:https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/]* portion of the URL for a Google Drive folder.
Once you have completed all of the above, you can then create a named storage connection string.
To create the names storage connection string you will need:

item.name: The JSON that you downloaded when you created new keys for your service account.
The id for the folder you want to point to with your named storage connection string.

description.p: Once you have created a named storage connection string for Google Drive you can then use any of the [a5storage* functions] (except *[xb:a5storage_copyFiles()]*) to read and save files to Google Drive.
